CliException - Exception in clishell.ex
CliException is the most generalized form of application exceptions generated by the CLI code; pretty much all of the CLI exceptions should derive from this class, and it is advised not to throw instances of this class directly in order to facilitate caller-level discernment of various classes of exceptions and error conditions.
CliException() - Constructor for exception clishell.ex.CliException
default constructor
CliException(String) - Constructor for exception clishell.ex.CliException
 
CliException(String, Throwable) - Constructor for exception clishell.ex.CliException
 
CliExceptionCollection - Exception in clishell.ex
CliExceptionCollection is a specialization of a CliException that also maintains a collection of "incidental exceptions" - exceptions that were thrown secondary to the initial exception that caused an instance of this class to be generated.
CliExceptionCollection() - Constructor for exception clishell.ex.CliExceptionCollection
default constructor
CliExceptionCollection(String) - Constructor for exception clishell.ex.CliExceptionCollection
 
CliExceptionCollection(String, Throwable) - Constructor for exception clishell.ex.CliExceptionCollection

CliPluginFinalizer - Annotation Type in clishell.anno
Finalizer plugin methods are methods that will be called by the CLI before unloading the plugin, in the order specified by the "ordering" attribute.
CliPluginInitializer - Annotation Type in clishell.anno
Initializer plugin methods are methods that will be called by the CLI immediately upon loading the plugin, in the order specified by the "ordering" attribute.
CliPluginLoader - Class in clishell
Loads and unloads CLI plugins
CliPluginLoader() - Constructor for class clishell.CliPluginLoader
 
CliPluginMain - Annotation Type in clishell.anno
"Main" plugin method annotation Main plugin methods are methods that will be called by the CLI for each initially loaded plugin, in the order the plugins were loaded, and within each plugin, in the order specified by the "ordering" attribute.

Class to store & manage metadata about a loaded CLI Plugin instance

CliProperties - Class in clishell
Custom Extension to java.util.Properties for CliShell, supporting following enhancements: getProperties enhancements:
Resolution of property references - the overridden getProperty methods will resolve references to other properties using the syntax: ${property-name} Two new getProperty methods: getProperty(String name, Class klass) and a variant of that taking a defaultValue parameter - can be used to return new instances of objects using values configured in the property file
getDottedProperty enhancements:
New flavor of "get property" methods: "getDottedProperty" A "dotted property name" is a property name comprising zero or more "components", separated by a dot ('.') character.
CliProperties() - Constructor for class clishell.CliProperties
 
CliProperties(Properties) - Constructor for class clishell.CliProperties

SUPPORTED_CLIMETHODFORMS - array specifying the set of currently supported java method types, according to classification specified by CliMethodForm; method operations on this class for other types may not work (especially the invoke() method and its variants)

T

TailCharBufferWriter - Class in clishell.plugins
Writer maintaining the "tail" (whose size is specified) of the stream of characters written to it, in a buffer that is accessible either by calling the "toString()" method, of by using a java.io.Reader that is available via the special getReader() method.
TailCharBufferWriter(int) - Constructor for class clishell.plugins.TailCharBufferWriter
 
TeeWriter - Class in clishell.plugins
Inspired by the Unix "tee" command, this Writer will send everything written to it to any number of other writers that are registered with it.
TeeWriter() - Constructor for class clishell.plugins.TeeWriter
Default constructor adds no underlying writers
TeeWriter(Writer...) - Constructor for class clishell.plugins.TeeWriter
Calls TeeWriter.TeeWriter(boolean, Writer...), passing true as the value of the owned parameter, meaning these underlying writer(s) will be "owned" by the created instance of TeeWriter.
TeeWriter(boolean, Writer, boolean, Writer) - Constructor for class clishell.plugins.TeeWriter
